name.value: Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego? Junior Detective Edition

item.description:
This is a newer edition of the "Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego" game but redesigned for younger players.

FROM THE BOX:
"Attention Parents of Junior Detectives:
Your children don't need to read to track Carmen Sandiego! That's right, America's most popular master thief is now appearing (and disappearing) in a new game designed to introduce young children to world geography.

Players secretly hide color coded pictures of Carmen Sandiego beneath countries, then search for pictures of their color. Kids will have so much fun searching for Carmen that they won't even notice that they're learning the sizes, shapes, and locations of the world's nations and oceans.

Carmen Sandiego already stars in the nation's top-selling geography games for ages 8 and up. Now, kids under 8 can discover what their older brothers and sisters already know-- hunting for Carmen is a fun way to learn!"

CONTENTS:
World Map Game Board
World Map Playing Pieces
33 Country/Region Cards
12 Carmen Sandiego Picture Tokens
4 Pawns
Complete Instructions

Ages 4-8

From the box:

Spinning the board as you go, you'll take turns placing letter tiles, earning points for each word you build. As long as letters are adjoining and in the proper sequence, words may be read in any direction - up and down, backwards and forwards.

Once the board is full, the player with the highest score wins! Fast-paced and easy to learn, Heximania can be played at various skill levels - perfect for the entire family.

Players alternate moving all of their pieces each turn, moving them diagonally only, but as far as they like, in an attempt to get them to the other side of the board, placing each numbered piece in its like numbered spot, with no jumping or captures allowed.

name.value: Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge

item.description:
Lee at Gettysburg : The Battle for Cemetery Ridge (by Mark H. Walker, Artwork by Nicolas Eskubi) simulates the first day of the battle of Gettysburg . The player controls the Confederate and Union formations that fought in the battle (by moving cardboard counters across the map and combating enemy formations).

The map includes McPherson’s Ridge, Gettysburg , Cemetery Hill, and the northern section of Cemetery Ridge. Each hex represents an area 250 yards wide. The counters represent brigades (600-700 men), artillery batteries (4-6 guns), and leaders. Each turn represents one hour.

This was "published" in the April 2004 issue of Armchair General - the issue contains a key one uses to download a PDF of the game.

Re-implemented by:

 Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge (Gold Edition)

link.value: Lee at Gettysburg: The Battle for Cemetery Ridge (Gold Edition)

item.description:
The Game of TONGUE TANGLE:

From the box:

Are you ready to play the game of selfish shellfish and Peggy Babcock?

Do you have the stamina to take the titanium tonsil challenge?

The game of Tongue Tangle contains tons of tortuous tongue twisters to tickle your tonsils.

Trick other players by secretly setting the special mechanical timer.....but watch out-it might come back to you, and then who would be stuck for words?

Try to catch out your opponents in the 'Hot Lips' round by saying your tongue twister and passing the 'wibbly wobbly wubber' lips to another player.

The first person to reach the tip of the twisty turny tongue track and survive the final 'Hot Lips' round triumphs!

Contents of the Norwegian Krøll på tunga? edition:

Game board
112 tongue tangle cards
Timer
Rubber lips
6 pawns
One die

From the box and rules:

When you play MIND YOUR LANGUAGE you will speak Swedish, eat spaghetti and see the Eiffel Tower, all from the comfort of your own living room!

Who can answer the questions you need to ask? Using the amazing Spear-o-phone pronunciation system, you can ask for paella in Spanish and moussaka in Greek!

Try and keep track of the answers in this tongue-tied tour of Europe, but watch out - there are tourists about who might give you an answer that you don't expect!

It's a game that breaks the language barriers.

You will find the questions that you need to ask in your personalized Travel Warrant. Can you find out who has the card with the right answer on it?

MIND YOUR LANGUAGE is a game about visiting different countries, in other words speaking the language, trying the food and seeing the sights. You do this by asking the other players questions from your travel wallets, trying to find the right answers - and then remembering which player holds the answers to which country!

PICASSO - How quick on the draw are you?

From the box:

"Be quick on the draw, then put a title to someone else's masterpiece. Whether you're an artistic genius or just a doodler, PICASSO is a riot of fun!

Pick a card to see which title, phrase or saying you have to draw. Each player has his own card, so everyone is drawing something different.

Race to complete your drawing. The first player finished yells 'Stop'. Now see if you can recognize what each of the others has drawn. Is that a picture of Pigs? could it be Animal Farm? Pigs might fly? Surely not Hamlet?

It's a quick draw game that'll have you in stitches, but be warned - PICASSO might drive you to abstraction."

From the box:

FIRST IMPRESSIONS is about the very people who play it. Have you had dinner with Attila the Hun, been married to a magnifying glass or just good friends with a cactus?

440 witty, perceptive, striking cartoons form the basis of this fast moving game where your imagination, eloquence and judgment can run wild.

The cards are played in turn and the idea is to cast your vote for the player to whom the card applies by using the voting masks with color changing eyes.

If you're the one they think is like a bowl of spaghetti then you collect that card. You could end up with a personality profile consisting of the The Leaning Tower of Pisa, Henry VIII, an octopus and a mango.

You can back your judgment and argue to sway the misguided opinion of others. Those that voted for you then move ahead in a race to the finish.

The game has two objectives:
- To advance your token on the board to be the first to reach the finish at the center of the board.
- To discover you image - the impression that you make on other people.
Which object you place above the other depends on you and the other players.

name.value: Spongebob Squarepants Bikini Bottom Book of Games

item.description:
From the back: "It's time for the Bikini Bottom Games! You can join in the events with five cool games. Four are based on favorite Spongebob Squarepants episodes and one is inspired by the Spongebob Movie. Are you ready to hunt for pirate treasure? Or avoid some fishing hooks? Spongebob, Patrick, Squidward, and Sandy are- they've been training all year and are ready to take on the competition, Let's go!"

This is a board book that contains five kids' games, small plastic figures of Spongebob, Patrick, Squidward, and Sandy, and a die. Best of all, the die is in a pop-a-matic bubble and the pieces store in a plastic case built into the book. The games are:

Road Trip
Hooky 
Argh!
Sandy's Rocket
Mrs. Puff's Boating School

item.description: 1965 board game based on the ABC network television sitcom of the same name which starred Ken Berry, Forrest Tucker and Larry Storch.

SECURICOR - An exciting game of chase involving banks, bullion and banditry.

One player is the Securicor Operator and the other player or players the thieves. The Securicor Operator's aim is to move the Securicor vans with the bullion loads safely from the banks to the factories. The Securicor Operator can choose whether to load both lots of bullion into one vehicle and use the other as a decoy, or load one lot into each vehicle.

During the journey the thieves try to intercept and rob the Securicor vans and take the bullion back to their own Headquarters. If a robbery takes place, the Securicor operator uses the police cars to try and recapture the bullion from the thieves. The thieves also can try and capture bullion loads from each other after a Securicor van has been robbed.

A complete game consists of five rounds (2 bullion loads per round). Players take it in turns to be the Securicor Operator.

At the end of five turns the winner is the player to have collected the most bullion.

It's a game for two players.
On a 9X8 checkered board they must move their colored pieces (4 blue, 4 yellow and 4 red) to capture their opponent's pieces; but during the game for every enemy piece captured, you have on the board one new piece of a complementary color (orange, green or purple. 
From then on what you can capture and with what is decided by a complex color chart. When a complementary color is captured, you can obtain a new black piece (the chameleon)with special rules.
